poem:
A Voice Unyielding  

In the echoing hall, words unfurl,  
An orator's breath, unbroken by time.  
Hakeem stands, a sentinel—  
Against the tide of gold-glint promises.  
Eight hours of resistance, of a voice  
Carving truth in the air,  
A silent roar, a whispered storm,  
Defiance shaped in the frail human form.
